Well, in two posts by now, Daewoo has mentioned some bits about the (in my opinion, rather impressive) arsenal of firearms he posesses. From Five-seveNs to civilian versions of the P90 to the, er, rather hard to use in real life .50 caliber Barrets.
 
 Well, I'm quite interested, what else have you got there (locked up tight and safe, I'm sure)? If you care to answer, of course.
 
 
 By now, I wouldn't be surprised by a Steyr AMR prototype and a Davy Crockett civilian version :)

I am a pretty serious collector. I have everything from 18th century dueling pistols to a minigun. 
 
 On a side note, everything automatic that I have is for sale. I bought it all as an investment and it has all appreciated in value (been an excellent investment) but I am afraid that the supreme court case that is soon to be heard will lead to a reversal of the GCA ban on production of automatic weapons and thus devalue them. I think I have the minigun sold.
 
 Half my basement is a vault. 14" of reinforced concrete and a 10" vault door. It is pretty secure.

You got it wrong Daewoo. The ban was put in place by the 1986 Firearm Owners Protection Act, designed to correct the erronius Gun Control Act of 1968. The machinegun ban provision was slipped in at the last minute, during a time when those that would oppose it weren't there to debate it.

I am a pretty serious collector. I have everything from 18th century dueling pistols to a minigun. 
 
 On a side note, everything automatic that I have is for sale. I bought it all as an investment and it has all appreciated in value (been an excellent investment) but I am afraid that the supreme court case that is soon to be heard will lead to a reversal of the GCA ban on production of automatic weapons and thus devalue them. I think I have the minigun sold.
 
 Half my basement is a vault. 14" of reinforced concrete and a 10" vault door. It is pretty secure.

 
 How much did the minigun cost to fire?

How much did the minigun cost to fire?

 
 I buy the ammunition for that by the pallet...literally. Mine is an M134 and I typically load 4000 rounds at a time. It is kind of a "special occasion" gun. I went to a shoot in Oklahoma a couple of years ago and went through just over $8000 in ammo during the course of the weekend.

Daewoo, I officially consider you insane, but in a good way :) A freaking MINIGUN?!? What, were MIRV ICBM's out of stock?
 
 Tell me, having one, how do you feel about every FPS game and their uncle having a man-portable one in them, fired on the run?

Daewoo, I officially consider you insane, but in a good way :) A freaking MINIGUN?!? What, were MIRV ICBM's out of stock?
 
 Tell me, having one, how do you feel about every FPS game and their uncle having a man-portable one in them, fired on the run?

 
 LOL. I have actually seen a man portable minigun. It fires .22LR rounds. As far as I know, there is only one in existance. 
 
 I bought the minigun as an investment. Paid $9800 for it. Had about $2000 worth of repair work on it done. Am in the process of arranging a sale one it....$455,000. Pretty good investment in the end.
 
 I have been building some interesting stuff that kind of takes some of the excitement out of the minigun. I did a tri barrel garner gun not long ago. Amazingly enough, with modern materials and production techniques, you can make a tri barreled garnder gun spit out 1800 rounds per minute, and since it is crank operated as opposed to electrically powered it is not considered a machine gun so there are no special controls on it. I am still working on a modern version of the old crank fired gatling gun. It is coming along pretty well, but the last prototype blew itself apart (9 rounds fired out of battery). I have a buddy who lives here and is a genius when it comes to building jsut about anything helping me. 
 
 I like my toys.

I like my toys.

 
 Yeah, I like your toys, too :)

I think everyone likes his toys... I wish I had the cash I'd buy some of your toys. I do have a few myself. heres a link to a few of mine..
 
 http://www.youtube.com/user/Trigger51B

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Daewoo's arsenal
